_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND RESPONSE POLICIES

Meritage Midstream is committed to the safety and health of its employees, contractors and visitors.  The commitment is demonstrated in the design, operation and maintenance programs developed and implemented specifically for this facility.  Operation and maintenance personnel are trained in the appropriate emergency response procedures to follow in the event of an accidental release.  However, accident prevention is the ultimate goal and, as such, a site-specific mechanical integrity program is being implemented and maintained.



FACILITY DESCRIPTION AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES

The 50 Buttes Gas Plant in located near Savageton in Campbell County, Wyoming.  It is a plant that is designed to extract natural gas liquids (ie. ethane, propane, butane, and heavier hydrocarbons) from raw natural gas stream to produce pipeline quality Natural Gas Liquids (NGLs).  The only process in the plant that contains and above the threshold quantity of a regulated substance in the NGL Storage Tanks.  There are no above threshold quantity toxic substances at the 50 Buttes Gas Plant. 



GERNRAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM

The 50 Buttes Gas Plant has developed and implemented a site-specific PSM program that consists of all the required 14 elements of PSM.  Since this facility is a Program Level 1 facility, a prevention program is not required under RMP.



FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

The 50 Buttes Gas Plant has had no accidental releases in the past 5 years that have resulted in offsite consequences.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

The 50 Buttes Gas Plant has developed and maintains a site-specific Emergency Response Plan (ERP) that includes actions to take in the event of an uncontrolled release of a hazardous substance.  The ERP includes the name and phone numbers of not only company personnel but also the names and phone numbers of support services (contractors, police departments, fire departments,

medical services/hospitals, regulatory agencies, LEPC, etc.) that may be called upon for assistance.  Liaison with those agencies is maintained to ensure timely and proper responses.  Employee understanding of their responsibilities during an emergency is high priority.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Meritage Midstream believes safety in an issue that can always be improved upon.  Meritage continues to look for, develop and implement programs that will improve an employee's ability to identify and correct potential workplace hazards. Meritage also endeavors to ensure policies, programs and procedures are developed and implemented to meet applicable laws, rules and regulations.  Employee understanding of these policies, programs and procedures is a high priority.
